MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2 is: A for loop shall be well-formed. The three clauses of a for statement are the: 1. First clause shall be empty or an expression whose set the value of the loop counter or define and intialize the loop counter. 2. Second clause shall be an expression that has no persistent side effects, and shall use the loop counter and optionally loop control flags, and shall not use any other object that is modified in the for loop body. 3.Third clause shall be an expression whose modify only the value of the loop counter, and shall not use objects that are modified in the for loop body. 4. There shall only be one loop counter in a for loop, which shall not be modified in for loop body. A loop control flag is defined as single identifier denoting an object with Boolean type that is used in the second clause. The behaviour of a for loop body includes the behaviour of any functions called within that statement. Provide your answer with these fields. - is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false), - scenario: a specific violation scenario. scenario: The for loop uses a single loop counter (category_idx) initialized in the first clause, the second clause is a read-only test NULL != categories[category_idx] (no persistent side effects and it does not reference any object modified in the loop body), and the third clause increments only the loop counter (category_idx++). The loop counter is not modified in the body. Therefore this for statement is well-formed and does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.2.
